path_1.title: Bird on a Wire (1990)
path_1.feeling: Light, breezy chase romance that goes down easy but fades fast.

path_1.feeling: Too saccharine for my taste despite a few sweet moments.

path_1.title: True Crime (1999)

path_1.title: Crumb (1994)

path_1.title: Fatal Attraction (1987)

path_1.title: Sleepy Hollow (1999)

path_1.title: Angel Heart (1987)

path_1.title: Alien (1979)

path_1.title: Mortal Thoughts (1991)

path_1.title: Lucie Aubrac (1997)

path_1.title: Hearts in Atlantis (2001)
path_1.feeling: Warm and wistful, a little too soft.

path_1.feeling: Creepy enough, standard but effective.

path_5.feeling: Inventive and clever, but the arch weirdness keeps me at a distance.

path_5.title: Unforgiven (1992)
path_5.feeling: Bleak, morally thorny western that lingers.

path_5.title: Apocalypse Now (1979)
path_5.feeling: Immersive and harrowing, even if the mythmaking keeps me a bit removed.

path_5.title: Ruby in Paradise (1993)
path_5.feeling: Quiet, humane slice‑of‑life that resonates.

path_5.title: Hearts in Atlantis (2001)
path_5.feeling: Warm and gentle, but a bit soft and sentimental.

path_5.title: Single White Female (1992)
path_5.feeling: Sleek, creepy roommate‑from‑hell thriller that delivers.

path_5.title: Scream (1996)
path_5.feeling: Sharp, playful slasher that still entertains.

path_5.title: Raiders of the Lost Ark (Indiana Jones and the Raiders of the Lost Ark) (1981)

path_5.title: Bird on a Wire (1990)
path_5.feeling: Easygoing chase caper with charm to spare but little staying power.

path_5.title: Hav Plenty (1997)
path_5.feeling: Low‑key charmer with heart, though the spark is intermittent.

path_5.title: Steel Magnolias (1989)
path_5.feeling: Warm ensemble comfort with laughs and a sugary glaze.

path_5.title: Simple Plan, A (1998)
path_5.feeling: Tight, snow‑bound morality tale of greed that gnaws.

path_5.title: Legend of Bagger Vance, The (2000)
path_5.feeling: Polished and earnest, but the fable‑like uplift feels thin.

path_5.feeling: Warm, observant wartime childhood memoir that rings true.

path_5.title: Little Mermaid, The (1989)
path_5.feeling: Colorful and catchy, even if the fairytale sweetness isn’t quite my thing.

path_5.title: E.T. the Extra-Terrestrial (1982)
path_5.feeling: Touching in parts, but the sentimentality and whimsy never clicked for me.

path_5.title: Grease (1978)
path_5.feeling: Lively and catchy, but the broad, campy vibe wears thin for me.

path_5.title: True Crime (1999)
path_5.feeling: Lean, deadline-driven investigation that scratched my suspense itch.

path_5.title: Crumb (1994)
path_5.feeling: Darkly funny, frank, and deeply revealing—uncomfortable in the right ways.

path_5.title: Fatal Attraction (1987)
path_5.feeling: Tense and propulsive, if a bit overheated and pulpy.

path_5.title: Sleepy Hollow (1999)

path_5.title: Angel Heart (1987)
path_5.feeling: Atmospheric and intriguing, though the occult noir left me a bit cold.

path_5.title: Alien (1979)

path_5.title: Mortal Thoughts (1991)
path_5.feeling: Grimy, morally thorny mystery with solid tension.

path_5.title: Lucie Aubrac (1997)
path_5.feeling: Humane resistance drama that balances love and peril with conviction.

path_5.feeling: Relentless, satisfying man-on-the-run thriller perfection for me.
